comments:
After upgrading to GTK+ 2.6.10, I get the following test failure in the  
org.eclipse.ui.tests.compare.UIComparePreferencesAuto.  The problem seems to  
be a change in event ordering.  If I block the UI thread just before the  
failure occurs, then the Restore Defaults and Apply buttons are missing.  If I  
spin the event loop just before the test occurs, then the Restore Defaults and  
Apply buttons appear.  I believe in this way it is possible to workaround the 
problem.  
 
I'm not sure if this points to a larger problem in SWT.  It is a vanilla GTK+ 
2.6.10 with two patches applied by Gentoo: 
"2.2.1-disable_icons_smooth_alpha.patch" and "2.6-smoothscroll-r5.patch.bz2". 
 
  
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Warning: Button {Restore &Defaults}
